verses.kjv: Ye are the children of the LORD your God: ye shall not cut yourselves, nor make any baldness between your eyes for the dead.
verses.web: You are the children of LORD your God. You shall not cut yourselves, nor make any baldness between your eyes for the dead.
verses.ct: You are the children of the LORD your God. Don't cut yourselves or shave the front of your heads as a way of mourning the dead.

verses.kjv: For thou art an holy people unto the LORD thy God, and the LORD hath chosen thee to be a peculiar people unto himself, above all the nations that are upon the earth.
verses.web: For you are a holy people to LORD your God, and LORD has chosen you to be a people for his own possession, above all peoples who are on the face of the earth.
verses.ct: You are a people set apart as holy to the LORD your God. Out of all the nations on earth, the LORD has chosen you to be his own treasured people.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt not eat any abominable thing.
verses.web: You shall not eat any abominable thing.
verses.ct: Don't eat anything that is detestable.

verses.kjv: These are the beasts which ye shall eat: the ox, the sheep, and the goat,
verses.web: These are the animals which you may eat: the ox, the sheep, the goat,
verses.ct: These are the animals you may eat: the ox, the sheep, and the goat,

verses.kjv: The hart, and the roebuck, and the fallow deer, and the wild goat, and the pygarg, and the wild ox, and the chamois.
verses.web: the deer, the gazelle, the roebuck, the wild goat, the ibex, the antelope, and the chamois.
verses.ct: the deer, the gazelle, the roebuck, the wild goat, the ibex, the antelope, and the chamois.

verses.kjv: And every beast that parteth the hoof, and cleaveth the cleft into two claws, and cheweth the cud among the beasts, that ye shall eat.
verses.web: Every animal that parts the hoof, and has the hoof split in two and chews the cud, among the animals, you may eat.
verses.ct: You may eat any animal that has a split hoof divided in two and also chews the cud.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless these ye shall not eat of them that chew the cud, or of them that divide the cloven hoof; as the camel, and the hare, and the coney: for they chew the cud, but divide not the hoof; therefore they are unclean unto you.
verses.web: Nevertheless these you shall not eat of them that chew the cud, or of those who have the hoof split: the camel, the hare, and the rabbit. Because they chew the cud but don’t part the hoof, they are unclean to you.
verses.ct: However, some animals only chew the cud or only have a split hoof — you must not eat those. The camel, the hare, and the coney chew the cud but don't have a split hoof, so they are unclean for you.

verses.kjv: And the swine, because it divideth the hoof, yet cheweth not the cud, it is unclean unto you: ye shall not eat of their flesh, nor touch their dead carcase.
verses.web: The pig, because it has a split hoof but doesn’t chew the cud, is unclean to you. You shall not eat their meat. You shall not touch their carcasses.
verses.ct: The pig has a split hoof but doesn't chew the cud, so it is unclean for you. Don't eat their meat, and don't even touch their carcasses.

verses.kjv: These ye shall eat of all that are in the waters: all that have fins and scales shall ye eat:
verses.web: These you may eat of all that are in the waters: you may eat whatever has fins and scales.
verses.ct: Of everything that lives in the water, you may eat anything that has both fins and scales.

verses.kjv: And whatsoever hath not fins and scales ye may not eat; it is unclean unto you.
verses.web: You shall not eat whatever doesn’t have fins and scales. It is unclean to you.
verses.ct: But anything in the water that doesn't have fins and scales — don't eat it. It is unclean for you.

verses.kjv: Of all clean birds ye shall eat.
verses.web: Of all clean birds you may eat.
verses.ct: You may eat any bird that is clean.

verses.kjv: But these are they of which ye shall not eat: the eagle, and the ossifrage, and the ospray,
verses.web: But these are they of which you shall not eat: the eagle, the vulture, the osprey,
verses.ct: But these are the birds you must not eat: the eagle, the vulture, the osprey,

verses.kjv: And the glede, and the kite, and the vulture after his kind,
verses.web: the red kite, the falcon, the kite after its kind,
verses.ct: the red kite, the falcon, and every kind of kite,

verses.kjv: And every raven after his kind,
verses.web: every raven after its kind,
verses.ct: every kind of raven,

verses.kjv: And the owl, and the night hawk, and the cuckow, and the hawk after his kind,
verses.web: the ostrich, the owl, the seagull, the hawk after its kind,
verses.ct: the ostrich, the night hawk, the seagull, and every kind of hawk,

verses.kjv: The little owl, and the great owl, and the swan,
verses.web: the little owl, the great owl, the horned owl,
verses.ct: the little owl, the great owl, the horned owl,

verses.kjv: And the pelican, and the gier eagle, and the cormorant,
verses.web: the pelican, the vulture, the cormorant,
verses.ct: the pelican, the carrion vulture, the cormorant,

verses.kjv: And the stork, and the heron after her kind, and the lapwing, and the bat.
verses.web: the stork, the heron after its kind, the hoopoe, and the bat.
verses.ct: the stork, every kind of heron, the hoopoe, and the bat.

verses.kjv: And every creeping thing that flieth is unclean unto you: they shall not be eaten.
verses.web: All winged creeping things are unclean to you. They shall not be eaten.
verses.ct: All winged insects are unclean for you. Don't eat them.

verses.kjv: But of all clean fowls ye may eat.
verses.web: Of all clean birds you may eat.
verses.ct: But you may eat any clean bird.

verses.kjv: Ye shall not eat of anything that dieth of itself: thou shalt give it unto the stranger that is in thy gates, that he may eat it; or thou mayest sell it unto an alien: for thou art an holy people unto the LORD thy God. Thou shalt not seethe a kid in his mother’s milk.
verses.web: You shall not eat of anything that dies of itself. You may give it to the foreigner living among you who is within your gates, that he may eat it; or you may sell it to a foreigner; for you are a holy people to LORD your God. You shall not boil a young goat in its mother’s milk.
verses.ct: Don't eat anything that has died on its own. You may give it to the foreigners living in your towns, and they can eat it, or you may sell it to an outsider. Remember — you are a people set apart as holy to the LORD your God. Also, don't boil a young goat in its mother's milk.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt truly tithe all the increase of thy seed, that the field bringeth forth year by year.
verses.web: You shall surely tithe all the increase of your seed, that which comes out of the field year by year.
verses.ct: Be sure to set aside a tenth of everything your fields produce each year.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt eat before the LORD thy God, in the place which he shall choose to place his name there, the tithe of thy corn, of thy wine, and of thine oil, and the firstlings of thy herds and of thy flocks; that thou mayest learn to fear the LORD thy God always.
verses.web: You shall eat before LORD your God, in the place which he chooses to cause his name to dwell, the tithe of your grain, of your new wine, and of your oil, and the firstborn of your herd and of your flock; that you may learn to fear LORD your God always.
verses.ct: Take the tithe of your grain, new wine, and olive oil, along with the firstborn of your herds and flocks, and eat it in the presence of the LORD your God at the place he chooses for his name to dwell. This will teach you to fear the LORD your God always.

verses.kjv: And if the way be too long for thee, so that thou art not able to carry it; or if the place be too far from thee, which the LORD thy God shall choose to set his name there, when the LORD thy God hath blessed thee:
verses.web: If the way is too long for you, so that you are not able to carry it because the place which LORD your God shall choose to set his name there is too far from you, when LORD your God blesses you,
verses.ct: But if the place the LORD your God chooses for his name is too far away, and the journey is too long for you to carry your tithe — especially when the LORD your God has blessed you with abundance —

verses.kjv: Then shalt thou turn it into money, and bind up the money in thine hand, and shalt go unto the place which the LORD thy God shall choose:
verses.web: then you shall turn it into money, bind up the money in your hand, and shall go to the place which LORD your God shall choose.
verses.ct: then sell your tithe, take the money with you, and travel to the place the LORD your God chooses.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt bestow that money for whatsoever thy soul lusteth after, for oxen, or for sheep, or for wine, or for strong drink, or for whatsoever thy soul desireth: and thou shalt eat there before the LORD thy God, and thou shalt rejoice, thou, and thine household,
verses.web: You shall trade the money for whatever your soul desires: for cattle, or for sheep, or for wine, or for strong drink, or for whatever your soul asks of you. You shall eat there before LORD your God, and you shall rejoice, you and your household.
verses.ct: Once there, spend the money on whatever you want — cattle, sheep, wine, strong drink, or anything else your heart desires. Then eat and celebrate there in the presence of the LORD your God, you and your whole household.

verses.kjv: And the Levite that is within thy gates; thou shalt not forsake him; for he hath no part nor inheritance with thee.
verses.web: You shall not forsake the Levite who is within your gates, for he has no portion nor inheritance with you.
verses.ct: And don't neglect the Levites living in your towns, because they have no land or inheritance of their own.

verses.kjv: At the end of three years thou shalt bring forth all the tithe of thine increase the same year, and shalt lay it up within thy gates:
verses.web: At the end of every three years you shall bring all the tithe of your increase in the same year, and shall store it within your gates.
verses.ct: At the end of every 3 years, bring the entire tithe of that year's produce and store it in your towns.

verses.kjv: And the Levite, (because he hath no part nor inheritance with thee,) and the stranger, and the fatherless, and the widow, which are within thy gates, shall come, and shall eat and be satisfied; that the LORD thy God may bless thee in all the work of thine hand which thou doest.
verses.web: The Levite, because he has no portion nor inheritance with you, as well as the foreigner living among you, the fatherless, and the widow who are within your gates shall come, and shall eat and be satisfied; that LORD your God may bless you in all the work of your hand which you do.
verses.ct: The Levites — who have no land or inheritance of their own — along with the foreigners, the orphans, and the widows living in your towns will come and eat until they're satisfied. Do this so that the LORD your God will bless you in everything you do.
